alert.note: Alert for Elk; Greenwood; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 04 at 11:53PM CDT until April 05 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN ELK...NORTHERN WILSON...WOODSON AND SOUTHEASTERN GREENWOOD COUNTIES... At 1153 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Toronto to 7 miles northeast of Fall River, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Fredonia, Yates Center, Toronto, Buffalo, Fall River, Benedict, New Albany, Coyville, Toronto Lake, Batesville, Rose, Cross Timbers State Park and Fall River State Park. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
